```{r}
# Landing page for Amazon Review
 url <-'http://www.trustpilot.com/review/www.amazon.com'
```

```{r}
 get_last_page <- function(html){

      pages_data <- html %>% 
                      # The '.' indicates the class
                      html_nodes('.pagination-page') %>% 
                      # Extract the raw text as a list
                      html_text()                   

      # The second to last of the buttons is the one
      pages_data[(length(pages_data)-1)] %>%            
        # Take the raw string
        unname() %>%                                     
        # Convert to number
        as.numeric()                                     
    }
```

```{r}
 first_page <- read_html(url)
    (latest_page_number <- get_last_page(first_page))
```

```{r}
# Generate a list of all relevant html's
list_of_pages <- str_c(url, '?page=', 1:latest_page_number)
```

```{r}
get_reviews <- function(html) {
  html %>%
    # The relevant tag
    html_nodes('.review-body') %>%
    html_text() %>%
    # Convert the list into a vector
    unlist()
}

get_reviewers_names <- function(html) {
  html %>%
    html_nodes('.user-review-name-link') %>%
    html_text() %>%
    unlist()
}
```


```{r}
get_review_dates <- function(html) {
  
  status <- html %>%
    html_node('time') %>%
    # The status information is this time a tag attribute
    html_attrs() %>%
    # Extract the second element
    map(2) %>%
    unlist()

  dates <- html %>%
    html_node('time') %>%
    html_attrs() %>%
    map(1) %>%
    # Parse the string into a datetime object with lubricate
    ymd_hms() %>%
    unlist()
  
  # Combine the status and dates information to filter one via the other
  return_dates <- tibble(status = status, dates = dates) %>%
    # Only these are actual reviews
    filter(status == 'ndate') %>%
    # Select and convert to vector
    pull(dates) %>%
    # Convert DateTimes to POSIX objects
    as.POSIXct(origin = '1970-01-01 00:00:00')
}
```
